1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Extra functions for rational numbers.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Decimal.Rational
6  ( -- * Shorthand
7    (%%), (//.), (//),
8    ratioHalf, ratioFracle,
9
10    -- * Round and truncate
11    ratioRoundAt, ratioRoundEvenAt,
12    ratioRoundPer, ratioRoundEvenPer,
13    ratioTruncAt, ratioTruncPer,
14    ratioRoundOutAt, ratioRoundOutPer,
15
16    -- * Floor and ceiling
17    ratioFloorAt, ratioFloorPer,
18    ratioCeilAt, ratioCeilPer,
19
20    -- * Quotient and remainder
21    ratioQuo, ratioRem, ratioQuoRem,
22  ) where
23
24import qualified Data.Ratio                     as R
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture       as O
26
27
28-- --------------------------------------------  Shorthand
29
30-- | 'Rational' version of 'R.%'.
31(%%) :: Integer -> Integer -> Rational
32(%%) = (R.%)
33
34-- | Integer part and proper fraction part of ratio of two numbers,
35--   i.e., /x/ '//.' /y/ == (/integer/, /proper-fraction/) of /x/ 'R.%' /y/.
36(//.) :: (Integral n) => n -> n -> (n, R.Ratio n)
37x //. y = (q, r R.% y) where (q, r) = x // y
38
39-- | Synonym of 'quotRem'.
40(//) :: (Integral n) => n -> n -> (n, n)
41(//) = quotRem
42
43-- | 1 'R.%' 2
44ratioHalf :: (Integral n) => R.Ratio n
45ratioHalf = 1 R.% 2
46
47-- | Unit rational number for decimal fractional length.
48ratioFracle :: (Integral i, Integral n) => i -> R.Ratio n
49ratioFracle l = 10 ^^ (- l)
50
51
52-- --------------------------------------------  Round and truncate
53
54-- let sh = show . fromRational
55-- let test l r = putStrLn $ sh (ratioRoundAt l r) ++ " | " ++ sh (ratioRoundEvenAt l r) ++ "  <-  " ++ sh r
56-- let test l r = putStrLn $ sh (ratioTruncAt l r) ++ "  <-  " ++ sh r
57-- test (0 :: Int)  `mapM_` ((%% 4) <$> [-8 .. 15])
58-- test (-2 :: Int) `mapM_` ((%% 1) <$> [-100, -50 .. 500])
59
60ratioRoundPerBy :: (Integral n) => (n -> O.Bin (R.Ratio n)) -> O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
61ratioRoundPerBy conv per r = signum r * conv int frac trunc where
62    (int, frac)  = properFraction (abs r / per)
63    trunc        = (int R.% 1) * per
64
65-- | Round rational number at decimal fractional length.
66ratioRoundAt :: (Integral l, Integral n) => l -> O.Map (R.Ratio n)
67ratioRoundAt = ratioRoundPer . ratioFracle
68
69-- | Round-to-even rational number at decimal fractional length.
70ratioRoundEvenAt :: (Integral l, Integral n) => l -> O.Map (R.Ratio n)
71ratioRoundEvenAt = ratioRoundEvenPer . ratioFracle
72
73-- | Round rational number per unit rational number.
74ratioRoundPer :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
75ratioRoundPer per = ratioRoundPerBy conv per where
76    conv _ frac trunc | frac >= ratioHalf  = trunc + per
77                      | otherwise          = trunc
78
79-- | Round-to-even rational number per unit rational number.
80ratioRoundEvenPer :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
81ratioRoundEvenPer per = ratioRoundPerBy conv per where
82    conv int frac trunc =
83        case frac `compare` ratioHalf of
84          GT -> trunc + per
85          EQ -> trunc + (if even int then 0 else per)
86          LT -> trunc
87
88-- | Truncate rational number at decimal fractional length.
89ratioTruncAt :: (Integral l, Integral n) => l -> O.Map (R.Ratio n)
90ratioTruncAt = ratioTruncPer . ratioFracle
91
92-- | Truncate rational number per unit rational number.
93ratioTruncPer :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
94ratioTruncPer = ratioRoundPerBy conv where
95    conv _ _ trunc = trunc
96
97-- | Round out (toward infinity) rational number at decimal fractional length.
98ratioRoundOutAt :: (Integral l, Integral n) => l -> O.Map (R.Ratio n)
99ratioRoundOutAt = ratioRoundOutPer . ratioFracle
100
101-- | Round out (toward infinity) rational number per unit rational number.
102ratioRoundOutPer :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
103ratioRoundOutPer per = ratioRoundPerBy conv per where
104    conv _ frac trunc | frac > 0  = trunc + per
105                      | otherwise = trunc
106
107
108-- --------------------------------------------  Floor and ceiling
109
110-- let sh = show . fromRational
111-- let test l r = putStrLn $ sh (ratioFloorAt l r) ++ "  |  " ++ sh (ratioCeilAt l r) ++ "  <-  " ++ sh r
112-- test (0 :: Int)  `mapM_` ((%% 4) <$> [-8 .. 15])
113
114ratioFloorPerBy :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n) -> O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
115ratioFloorPerBy conv per r = conv frac trunc where
116    (int, frac)  = properFraction (r / per)
117    trunc        = (int R.% 1) * per
118
119-- | Floor rational number at decimal fractional length.
120ratioFloorAt :: (Integral l, Integral n) => l -> O.Map (R.Ratio n)
121ratioFloorAt = ratioFloorPer . ratioFracle
122
123-- | Floor rational number per unit rational number.
124ratioFloorPer :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
125ratioFloorPer per = ratioFloorPerBy conv per where
126    conv frac trunc | frac < 0   = trunc - per
127                    | otherwise  = trunc
128
129-- | Ceiling rational number at decimal fractional length.
130ratioCeilAt :: (Integral l, Integral n) => l -> O.Map (R.Ratio n)
131ratioCeilAt = ratioCeilPer . ratioFracle
132
133-- | Ceiling rational number per unit rational number.
134ratioCeilPer :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
135ratioCeilPer per = ratioFloorPerBy conv per where
136    conv frac trunc | frac > 0   = trunc + per
137                    | otherwise  = trunc
138
139
140-- --------------------------------------------  Quotient and remainder
141
142-- | Quotient of two ratio numbers.
143--
144--   >>> ratioQuo (5 %% 1) (2 %% 3)
145--   7 % 1
146--
147ratioQuo :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
148ratioQuo x y = fst $ ratioQuoRem x y
149
150-- | Remainder of two ratio numbers.
151--
152--   >>> ratioRem (5 %% 1) (2 %% 3)
153--   1 % 3
154--
155ratioRem :: (Integral n) => O.Bin (R.Ratio n)
156ratioRem x y = snd $ ratioQuoRem x y
157
158-- | Quotient and remainder of two ratio numbers.
159--
160--   >>> ratioQuoRem (5 %% 1) (2 %% 3)
161--   (7 % 1, 1 % 3)
162--
163ratioQuoRem :: (Integral n) => R.Ratio n -> R.Ratio n -> (R.Ratio n, R.Ratio n)
164ratioQuoRem = ratioQuoRem'
165
166ratioQuoRem' :: (Num n, RealFrac r) => r -> r -> (n, r)
167ratioQuoRem' x y = (fromInteger i, y * f) where
168    (i, f) = properFraction (x / y)
169
